reviewText: I'm going to start by saying that this game is fun and I did not receive motion sickness while playing it.\nThe motion controls are crap in the game though. They don't add anything to it except for horrible steering (which is done with the touchpad). They basically just use the motion controls as a controller and not for motion. They only have them in it so they can say they use motion controllers. You do not steer with the controllers, you use the track bad. For power ups and boost you also just press the touchpads. While the tracks are nice to look at, they are short and are basically just flat ground with nothing else. If you are looking for motion controlled mario kart then you are looking in the wrong place. Maybe with future updates they will make them better but I doubt it since this is not even a early release or alpha or beta.
voteText: 16 of 19 people (84%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
I'd love to actually play this game, but the current control system is broken.  I tried racing and my driver kept steering off in different directions even when not touching the Vive touchpad.  Conversely, it would sometimes stop steering even when using the touchpad.  There also doesn't appear to be any support for driving wheels, whereas the Rift version advertises that support.

There is also no in-game representation of the Vive controllers even in the menu.  This makes it difficult to know exactly where on the track pad you are pressing, since you have no visual feedback, but they still divide the trackpad into multiple buttons.

It's disappointing how something as basic as getting the controls wrong can break an otherwise promising looking game.

Updated: I tried it with an Xbox 360 controller and that worked fine.  It was actually controllable.  However, the game did not specifically indicate it could use an Xbox controller; the custom controller setup also only seems to work with the Xbox controller but not the Vive controllers.

reviewText: A great little racer, well worth the money. It'll be even better when there are more people to race against online.\n\nOnly issue I had is with the controls - it forced me to use an Xbox controller because it wouldn't pick up Right trigger when using the motion controls. Apart from that, it's a really fun game, the courses are decent and the power-ups are well balanced. Definitely recommend.

reviewText:
The game is a little rough around the edges at the moment, but I'd recommend it based on the fact that it's in the vein of games I'd like to see more of.

Pros:
Functional cart racing game
VR implementation is decent
Game runs fairly well

Cons:
Controls can be a bit finicky, especially if you're using the motion controllers instead of a gamepad (I recommend the gamepad)
There is a very low pop right now so multiplayer matches are hard to come by
There are a few sync issues in MP
